definitions.text: the distinctive form in which a thing is made
examples: pottery of this cast was found throughout the region
more men of his stamp are needed

definitions.text: a symbol that is the result of printing or engraving
examples: he put his stamp on the envelope

definitions.text: a small adhesive token stuck on a letter or package to indicate that that postal fees have been paid
something that can be used as an official medium of payment
a small piece of adhesive paper that is put on an object to show that a government tax has been paid
machine consisting of a heavy bar that moves vertically for pounding or crushing ores
a block or die used to imprint a mark or design
a device incised to make an impression; used to secure a closing or to authenticate documents

examples: The men stomped through the snow in their heavy boots

definitions.text: to mark, or produce an imprint in or on something
examples: a man whose name is permanently stamped on our maps

definitions.text: reveal clearly as having a certain character
examples: His playing stamps him as a Romantic

definitions.text: treat or classify according to a mental stereotype
examples: I was stereotyped as a lazy Southern European

definitions.text: destroy or extinguish as if by stamping with the foot
form or cut out with a mold, form, or die
crush or grind with a heavy instrument
